trigger_event: While repairing utility lines beneath Council headquarters amid system breakdowns, Lenart Kova uncovers a hidden cache containing a burned paper ledger, as well as hand-drawn system diagrams and annotated code, revealing secret privilege exceptions and an undocumented BCI reset protocol.
dilemma: Lenart Kova must decide whether to make the Council’s corruption public, inciting popular outrage, or to secretly help restore order by attempting a quiet system reset that could either stabilize or further disrupt the city.
reason: Kova is torn between his drive to expose injustice after a late-night, whisky-fueled conversation with Alex—who challenges him to finally take a side—and his belief that fixing the system from the inside may spare Stenograd from total chaos. He feels both paths might make him complicit in dangerous outcomes, but knows he cannot do both.
choice_a: Make the burned privilege ledger accessible to protestors, exposing Council corruption and fueling public outrage.
belief_a: Corruption must be dragged into the open, no matter the consequences.
True legitimacy can only come through transparency, even if order collapses.
Ordinary people deserve proof, not just rumors, that the system is rigged.
choice_b: Secretly deliver Halden’s diagrams and code to Lintz, and help her covertly trigger a risky BCI reset.
belief_b: Restoring order secretly is safer than letting the city tear itself apart.
Technical solutions, not outrage, are the path to long-term reform.
Confusion and anarchy only empower the worst factions; repairing the system is the best hope for real change.
